triasic_dinosaurs.name: Alwalkeria
triasic_dinosaurs.description: Alwalkeria was a small, basal saurischian dinosaur that roamed the earth during the Late Triassic period, approximately 228 to 200 million years ago. It was around 1 meter (3.3 feet) in length and had a slender, lightweight build, with an estimated weight of around 10 kilograms (22 pounds).

triasic_dinosaurs.name: Coelophysis
triasic_dinosaurs.description: Coelophysis was a delicately-built carnivore with a pair of slender legs bearing three-toed feet. Its pair of arms had four fingers each, although the last digits were considerably small. The head/skull of the creature bore a strong jaw lined with small but sharp and serrated teeth.

triasic_dinosaurs.name: Plateosaurus
triasic_dinosaurs.description: Plateosaurus is a genus of plateosaurid dinosaur that lived during the Late Triassic period, around 214 to 204 million years ago, in what is now Central and Northern Europe. Plateosaurus is a basal (early) sauropodomorph dinosaur, called prosauropod.

triasic_dinosaurs.name: Asylosaurus
triasic_dinosaurs.description: Asylosaurus was a species of dinosaur that existed in the late Triassic period in present day England. It is estimated to have existed 235 to 201 million years ago. It was an herbivorous type of dinosaur, a characteristic that was seen amongst most of the dinosaurs of the Mesozoic Era.

triasic_dinosaurs.name: Eoraptor
triasic_dinosaurs.description: Eoraptor is a genus of small, lightly built, basal sauropodomorph dinosaur. One of the earliest known dinosaurs and one of the earliest sauropodomorphs, it lived approximately 231 to 228 million years ago, during the Late Triassic in Western Gondwana, in the region that is now northwestern Argentina.

triasic_dinosaurs.name: Staurikosaurus
triasic_dinosaurs.description: Staurikosaurus was a small theropod from the late Triassic Period, 225 million years ago - specifically the Carnian age. It is one of the earliest dinosaurs that is known. It was a bipedal carnivore that lived in what is now South America.

triasic_dinosaurs.name: Pisanosaurus
triasic_dinosaurs.description: Pisanosaurus is an extinct genus of early dinosauriform, likely an ornithischian or silesaurid, from the Late Triassic of Argentina. It was a small, lightly built, ground-dwelling herbivore, that could grow up to an estimated 1 m (3.3 ft) long.

triasic_dinosaurs.name: Camposaurus
triasic_dinosaurs.description: Camposaurus is a genus of dinosaur from the Late Triassic period. It was a small, bipedal carnivore that lived in what is now South America. Camposaurus was a member of the theropod group of dinosaurs, which includes modern birds.

triasic_dinosaurs.name: Chindesaurus
triasic_dinosaurs.description: Chindesaurus is an extinct genus of basal saurischian dinosaur from the Late Triassic (213-210 million years ago) of the southwestern United States. It is known from a single species, C. bryansmalli, based on a partial skeleton recovered from Petrified Forest National Park in Arizona.

triasic_dinosaurs.name: Coloradisaurus
triasic_dinosaurs.description: Coloradisaurus is a genus of basal sauropodomorph dinosaur from the Late Triassic period of Argentina. It was a small, bipedal herbivore that lived in what is now South America. Coloradisaurus was a member of the sauropodomorph group of dinosaurs, which includes the long-necked sauropods.

triasic_dinosaurs.name: Dromomeron
triasic_dinosaurs.description: Dromomeron (meaning 'running femur') is a genus of lagerpetid avemetatarsalian which lived around 220 to 211.9 Â± 0.7 million years ago. The genus contains species known from Late Triassic-age rocks of the Southwestern United States and northwestern Argentina.

triasic_dinosaurs.name: Daemosaurus
triasic_dinosaurs.description: Daemonosaurus is an extinct genus of possible theropod dinosaur from the Late Triassic of New Mexico. The only known fossil is a skull and neck fragments from deposits of the latest Triassic Chinle Formation at Ghost Ranch.

triasic_dinosaurs.name: Eocursor
triasic_dinosaurs.description: Eocursor is genus of basal ornithischian dinosaur that lived in what is now South Africa during the Early Jurassic. Remains of this animal have been found in the Upper Elliot Formation and it is among the most completely known early ornithischians, shedding new light on the origin of the group.

triasic_dinosaurs.name: Gojirasaurus
triasic_dinosaurs.description: Gojirasaurus is a genus of 'coelophysoid' theropod dinosaur from the Late Triassic of New Mexico. It is named after the giant monster movie character Godzilla (Gojira if read in japanese).

triasic_dinosaurs.name: Lotosaurus
triasic_dinosaurs.description: Lotosaurus is an extinct genus of sail-backed poposauroid known from Hunan Province of central China. It lived during the Late Triassic period, around 220 million years ago. Lotosaurus was a herbivorous dinosaur that had a long neck and a large sail on its back.
